Lamadugh (Also known as Lamadug) is a popular full-day trek in Manali. The trail starts from Dhungri, about two km away from Manali, and involves walking through thick Deodar forests with a moderate uphill climb. The trail winds through pine, oak, horse chestnut, maple, and cedar forests to come to picturesque glades.

column10:
Khechopalri, originally known as Kha-Chot-Palri, is a magical lake that means "heaven of Padmasambhava," and locally, it is known as Sho Dzo Sho, which means "Oh Lady, Sit Here." According to folklore, 4 lakes in the region represent 4 different parts of the human body. This lake represents the thorax of the human body. The other 3 lakes are the Yuksom (the third eye), Tashiding (head), and Pemayangtse (the heart).

It offers a different quality of the Himalayas—arid mountain deserts and sparse vegetation with only a touch of snow in the summit stretch.
